title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 6, ch. I, subch. J, pt. 180 - Miscellaneous Regulations
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 6, ch. I, subch. J, pt. 180 - Miscellaneous Regulations

State Regulations
§ 180.1 - Animals dangerous to health or welfare
§ 180.2 - Seizure of diseased native fish and feral animals
§ 180.3 - Definition and use of firearms, guns, and airguns
§ 180.4 - Definition of resident owners or lessees actually occupying and cultivating farm lands
§ 180.5 - Definition of trout waters
§ 180.6 - Free sport fishing days
§ 180.8 - Definition of archery equipment
§ 180.9 - Fish dangerous to indigenous fish populations
§ 180.10 - Game species reporting
§ 180.11 - Sale of eggs from trout, lake trout, and atlantic salmon
§ 180.12 - Eurasian boar

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 6, ch. I, subch. J, pt. 180

Statutory authority: Environmental Conservation Law, §§3-0301, 11-0325, 11-1905, 27-0703

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
